name: Spy's Demise
overview: Sneak your way through the Soviet Embassy in Pyongyang via elevators, avoiding Soviet security on different floors to piece together the encrypted message. This is a platform game. You move from floor to floor avoiding the security that is constantly moving up and down on elevators. As you climb, you will collect all of the pieces that form an encrypted message as you advance to the next level. Spy's Demise is an action game written by Alan Zeldin for the Apple II, published by Penguin Software in 1982 . It was ported to the Atari, Commodore 64, Texas Instruments TI-99/4A, and Vector-06c. The game contained a puzzle which could be solved for a Spy's Demise T-Shirt. According to Antic magazine in June 1984, only four people had solved it. Published in Loadstar #029.
